title: What do staff say about feeling pressured to work when unwell and how has this changed?
analysis_commentary: In 2009, just over one fifth of staff reported that they felt pressure to attend work when feeling unwell in the previous three months. Subsequently, there has been a year-on-year increase in staff reporting feeling pressure to work when feeling unwell, rising to 27% in 2012. Between 2011 and 2012, the change is greater than observed between previous years, with a 5 percentage point increase; compared to less than 1 percentage point increases between the previous years.
data_source: Department of Health, Survey of NHS staff
